messages.message:
How can I remove a mounted drive if I renamed it `Instabase Drive` ?
Steps to reproduce:
1- Mount an S3 drive with any name
2- Change the mounted drive’s name to `Instabase Drive`
3- The drive’s icon will change to the instabase drive’s icon (the cloud)
4- Both drives will exist at the same time, however only one could be selected
https://www.loom.com/share/1f9ab7bdfbbb42828031e2cddfeff393

wow, nice find. We really should’ve blocked allowing the creation of drives named Instabase Drive (and Local Drive). I’ll add that in now to prevent this in the future… and try to clean up the db on this one. Can you link me to that drive?

Heh, I don't think there will be a way to do this from the UI... we give different behavior for instabase drive, but it's all based on the name right now. I'd need to go revisit whether there's a different identifier I should be using
@Heymian I can also add in a check in the UI to make sure they don't get renamed this way
UI check would be great too!! going to keep looking back here :thinking_face:
Maybe it's just checking upon creating, not renaming?
@Heymian I just gave you access on the repo https://uat.dogfood.instabase.com/test_user
